channel.title: Numbers at end of line, dumb question PLZ HELP
channel.description: I know this is prolly a dumb question but i'm kinda new to the coding stuff. Whenever i want an npc dialogue type thing I know it would be something like this... [code] sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a prayer level!", 6243); sendFrame126("Your prayer level is now "+playerLevel[5]+" .", 6244);[/code] I am wodering what the 6243 and 6244 at the end of the lines are. Also i want to know when i add a new frame126 what numbers do i put at the end instead of 6243 and 6244. Please Help and please don't make fun of me. Thanks

item.title: Numbers at end of line, dumb question PLZ HELP

item.description:
@Enjoy_me_now wrote:

Thats the id numerb for the npc dont change it it might make a bug

sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just advanced a prayer level!", 6243); sendFrame126("Your prayer level is now "+playerLevel[5]+" .", 6244);
I am wodering what the 6243 and 6244 at the end of the lines are. Also i want to know when i add a new frame126 what numbers do i put at the end instead of 6243 and 6244. Please Help and please don’t make fun of me. Thanks[/quote]

i think it tells it what pixel or frame to write the code ot im not sure i just know if you dont use the right one it looks weird
